sentences: For the AWG-LCA, the first part of 2009 focused on developing draft negotiating text.
This process resulted in a text that was nearly 200 pages long and covered all the main elements of the Bali Action Plan.
Because of the length of the text, delegates started to produce non-papers, reading guides, tables and matrices aimed at making the negotiating text more manageable.
The outcome was a series of non-papers, forwarded to Copenhagen as an annex to the meeting report.

Heading into Copenhagen, many felt the AWG-LCA had made satisfactory progress on adaptation, technology and capacity building but that deep divides remained on mitigation and certain aspects of finance.
